Title: Ocean's Eleven
Author: Ted Griffin  George Clayton Johnson  Jack Golden Russell  Harry Brown  Charles Lederer

Replies.Reply: Please state your name for the record.
Thank you. Mr. Ocean, the purpose of this meeting is to determine whether, if released, you are likely to break the law again.
Booby traps aren't Mr. Tarr's style.
As you say, ma'am, I was never charged.
My wife left me. I was upset.    I got into a self-destructive pattern.
She already left me once. I don't think she'll do it again just for kicks.
I don't know. How much do you guys make a year?
You kidding? I just became a citizen again.
Yes, Officer Brooks? My name is Danny Ocean. I'm just out, I'm supposed to check in with you within twenty-four hours.
No, sir, I haven't gotten into any trouble. No drinking, no sir.
No, sir, I wouldn't even think of leaving the state.
The bouncer mentioned there was a game in progress. I hope I'm not intruding.
I just got out of prison.
Well, that's all behind us now.
I raise you five hundred dollars.
What? Your girlfriend holding your purse?
Contrary to what Mr. Ryan may say, Seth, I always check my cards before I make a bet. But be cafeful. I could tell from your face you're holding three of a kind or better.
Five hundred to call. And two grand more.
Hey, I hate to ask this, but could you sign something for me?
Why do you think I came to see you first?
Ten grand.   Half of it's yours.
I've got something better for you.
It's tricky. No one's ever done it before. Needs planning, a large crew.
When's the last time you were in Vegas?
These feed into the cages at both the Mirage and the M.G.M. Grand.
But every dime ends up here.

Because yesterday I walked out of the joint wearing my entire wardrobe and you're colddecking TeenBeat coverboys.
A little. Did I rush it?   It felt like I rushed it.

The Bellagio, Mirage, and the M.G.M. Grand.
What do you have against him?

So he can walk on a rope.
So he can juggle. We need a grease man, not an acrobat. Who else is on the list?
Ten should do it, don't you think?
You think we need one more?
You think we need one more.
A friend of Bobby Caldwell's.   Sit down.
Bobby told me about you. Said you were the best set of hands he ever saw. Didn't expect to find you working wallets on the subway.
You're either in or out, right now.
A plane ticket. A job offer.
Bobby has every faith in you.
You do this job, he'll be trading on yours.
We'll get someone else who won't be quite as good. You can go back to feeling up stockbrokers.
That's the best lift I've seen you make yet.
Everybody eaten? Good. Everybody sober? Close enough. Most of you know each other already. You probably haven't met Linus Caldwell before, he's Bobby's kid outta Chicago.

Okay. Before we start, nobody's on the line here yet. What I'm about to propose to you happens to be both highly lucrative and highly dangerous. If that doesn't sound like your particular brand of vodka, help yourself to as much food as you like and safe journey. No hard feelings.
Courtesy of Frank Catton, new blackjack dealer at the Bellagio, security tapes from the three casinos.
Okay.    Bad news first. This place houses   a security system which rivals   most nuclear missile silos.
-- which anyone knows takes more than a smile. Next: through these doors, each of which requires a different six-digit code changed every twelve hours.
-- and vocal confirmations from both the security center within the Bellagio and the vault below - -
Furthermore, the elevator shaft is rigged with motion detectors --

Once we've gotten down the shaft, though, then it's a walk in the park: just three more guards with Uzis and predilections toward not being robbed, and the most elaborate vault door conceived by man. Any questions?

The Nevada Gaming Commission stipulates: a casino must hold in reserve enough cash to cover every chip at play on its floor. As I mentioned, this vault services each of the three casinos above it. That means: during the week, by law, it must hold anywhere from sixty to seventy million dollars in cash and coin. On a weekend, between eighty and ninety million.
Oh, right. Sorry. I forgot to mention that.
First task: reconnaissance. I want to know everything that's going on in all three casinos.
Most of all, I want you guys to know these casinos. They were built as labyrinths, to keep people in. I want you guys to know the quick routes out.
Second task: power. On the night of the fight, we're gonna throw the switch on sin city. Basher, it's your show.
Why do they paint hallways that color?
We need to build an exact, working replica of the Bellagio vault.
Fifth task: intelligence. We need those codes, Linus. From the only man who has all three.
For now. You gotta walk before you crawl.
Saul, you sure you're ready to do this?
There's a little over twenty grand there, Saul. Try to make it last.
You said you needed a reason.
If things go to plan, I won't be the one who has to make that choice.
How'd she look by the way?
Of prison. You remember. The day I went for cigarettes and never came back. You must have noticed.
They said I'd paid my debt to society.
You're doing a great job curating the museum.
The Vermeer is quite good. Simple but vibrant. Although his work definitely fell off as he got older.
And I still get Monet and Manet confused. Which one married his mistress?
You don't know how many times I played this conversation out in my head the last two years.
Okay. I'll make this quick. I came here for you. I'm gonna get on with my life, and I want you with me.
I only lied about being a thief.
No, he's very clear on both.
You can't. But what you can do is not throw away another five years.
Listen, you don't love me anymore, you want to make a life with someone else? Fine, I'll have to live with that. But not him.
Yes. But that doesn't mean I'm wrong.
You said: you better know what you're doing.
I was shocked myself.   Imagine the odds.
About the same. Everything you want is still on the other side.
I just wanted to say hello.   For old time's sake.
So I should put those towels back.
Alright, back it up, back it up!
I say stay in the van, you stay in the van, got it? 'Cause you lose focus for one second in this game, and someone gets hurt.
Who told you to do that?
Try to keep your tongue in your mouth.
I just came to say good-bye.

Guys: Day One: what's the first rule of poker?

Replies.Reply: Hell, I think Reuben bought it, and he knew we were screwing around.
May I have a word with Mr.
In this town, your luck can change just that quickly.
No.   You're gonna carry it out for us.
As your manager's probably reporting to you by now, you have a little over a hundred sixty million in your vault tonight.
You may notice: we're only packing up about half that. The other half we're leaving in your vault, booby-trapped, as a hostage.
You let our eighty million go, and you get to keep your eighty.
Mr. Benedict: you can lose eighty million dollars secretly tonight or you can lose a hundred sixty million dollars publicly. It's your decision.
He's fine. He wants you to go upstairs, and watch TV.
Good. Here's what you do. Five minutes from now, the men in the vault are going to deposit six bags in the vault elevator.
If they meet anyone, we'll blow the money in the bags and the money in the vault.
One minute after that, the elevator will rise to your cages.
If they take more than twenty seconds to reach the casino floor or if there's any indication a switch has been made, we'll blow the money in the vault and the money in the bags.
Of course, I'm in the casino. In fact, I'm staying in your hotel.
Your guards will load the bags into the van's rear. If anyone so much as approaches the driver's door, we blow everything.
Now, when I get word that the van hasn't been followed, that the money is secure, my men will exit the building, and once their safety is confirmed, you'll get your vault back.
Where do you want to go first?
I stopped and picked up your personal effects, put them in the back seat.

Look, we all go way back. I owe you from that thing with the guy in the place, and I'll never forget it.

Of course.   Anything for the N.G.C.
If he is who you say he is.
I know Hal Lindley over there.
Mr. Escalante. Would you come with us, please?
I think it's better if we talked off the floor.
Please show this man off the premises.
Don't step foot in my casino again.
You know how to get back out?
See who's on the other end.
What the hell is going on down there in the vault?
Find out how much money we have down there.
Replies.Didascalie: (close to apoplectic, takes a breath and cups the phone, then barks at Walsh)

Replies.Reply: Alright. You've proved your point. You've broken into my vault. Congratulations: you're a dead man.
May I ask: how do you expect to leave here, hmm?
Do you believe I'll simply allow you to parade bags full of my money out my casino doors?
And why would I do that?
He's in the casino right now.
Sir, I have complied with your every request, would you agree?
Good.   Now I have one of my own.
sports car in Newport Beach, I'll be supremely disappointed.
Get everyone in position. I want my vault back before that van hits the tarmac.
hustling through the cage corridors, armed to the teeth, with body armor and helmets and vision guards: they're as faceless as storm troopers.
Tell them to take the van. I'm going down there.
Find out how they fiddled with our cameras.
Walsh: How are we with the van?
What do you mean there was no money in the bags?
Walsh, cue up the tape of the robbery.
Does it say 'Bellagio' on the south wall of the vault?
We had that installed on Tuesday.
Someone built a double of my vault, then made a tape of them robbing it. When we saw them putting money in those bags, that wasn't actually happening.
Did you have a hand in this?
Escort Mr. Ocean to the exit. And contact the police. I would imagine Mr. Ocean is in violation of his parole.
Mr. Zerga, sir. Lyman Zerga. In the third position. Wishes to speak with you privately.
Businessman of some kind, working mostly in Europe. He's very vague, but I asked around. Word is he deals primarily in arms.
Yessir.    That's why I don't doubt it.
Checked in two nights ago, sir.

You don't want to get in the hole too heavy to this Benedict. A friend of mine once borrowed a hundred g's from the guy. Two months went by, Benedict hadn't heard from him, he calls my friend up, asks 'Where's my money?' I'll get to it when I get to it,' my friend says. Half hour later Benedict's in my friend's hotel room, dangling him off his 10th floor balcony by his feet. 'You gonna get to it now?'  High Roller turns over a nine.     Saul wins.
Eh. They put too much grenadine in my Shirley Temple.
Danny, Basher, and Yen squat side-by-side-by-side, watching all this. Yen makes a colorful observation about Linus's predicament; of course, no one understands it.
Danny and Basher slowly turn: Turk and Virgil crouch inches behind them, wanting to spectate as well.
Not   in a couple hours. You want him   out? I can bounce him from the   state for parole violation if you   like.
Saul?   Saul Bloom, is that you?
Saul, it's me. Bucky Buchanan, remember? From Saratoga.
I put two plainclothes on Ocean.
This is our security center, where we oversee all gaming in the casino as well as our vault.
Does that satisfy you, Mr. Zerga?
You're too late, guys.   He's dead.
Hello, this is Mr. Walsh at the Bellagio.
Our guys say the van is headed toward McCarren Airport.
And they blew up the bags, sir.
They say it doesn't look like there was any money in the bags, sir.
They say the bags were filled with fliers. For hookers.
That's what they said, sir. I don't understand it: we both saw them putting money inside those bags.
Maybe we should have held him.
Okay.   Leave the cart. Go find it.
Replies.Didascalie: (and this, he knows, will get this guard fired)

Replies.Reply: Overhead security-cam view of the vault corridor: the three Uzi guards stand idly, on duty. And of the vault itself: Yen trying to get out of the cash cart.
Night goggles on. Prepare to cut power.
Okay, guys, grab your gear and clear out.
First wave, in! Second wave, now!

Replies.Didascalie: (V.O.) (there is RUNNING, PANTING, then Linus's voice, distant and panicked)

Replies.Reply: Get out of the van, now!   Now!
Out of the van now! Hands up!
